raw_text:
Based on the paper content, I'll extract the structured information:

```json
{
  "paper_metadata": {
    "title": "Tackling Poverty in Fragile and Conflict-affected Areas: Evidence from a 'Big-Push' Program in Afghanistan",
    "matches_expected_title": "NO"
  },
  "program_information": {
    "program_name": "Targeting the Ultra Poor (TUP)",
    "country": "Afghanistan",
    "region": "Balkh province",
    "target_population": "Ultra-poor households, particularly women"
  },
  "intervention_components": {
    "component_a_cash_support": {
      "component_a_present": true,
      "cash_support_type": "consumption stipend",
      "cash_amount": "USD 54 PPP (USD 15 nominal)",
      "cash_frequency": "monthly installments for 12 months",
      "is_loan_or_credit": "NO",
      "cash_evidence_citation": "Women in treatment households received the one-off package including [...] a consumption stipend of USD 54 PPP (USD 15 nominal) delivered in 12 monthly installments"
    },
    "component_b_assets": {
      "component_b_present": true,
      "assets_provided": ["livestock (cows, sheep, goats)"],
      "direct_provision": "YES",
      "assets_evidence_citation": "Women in treatment households received the one-off package including a transfer of livestock -typically cows, and occasionally sheep and goats worth approximately USD 1,312 PPP (USD 357 nominal)"
    }
  },
  "study_characteristics": {
    "outcomes_measured": [
      "consumption/expenditure",
      "food security/nutrition",
      "asset accumulation",
      "savings/financial",
      "labor supply",
      "income/earnings",
      "psychological well-being",
      "women's empowerment",
      "child health",
      "education"
    ],
    "outcomes_evidence_citation": "We study the impact of the program on consumption, food security, assets, finance, time spent working, income and revenues, mental health, women's empowerment, child health, and education",
    "study_design": "Randomized Controlled Trial (RCT)",
    "design_evidence_citation": "1,219 of the poorest households across 80 villages were randomly assigned through a public lottery to either a treatment or a control group",
    "is_review_or_policy_analysis": false,
    "publication_year": null,
    "study_conducted_year": "2015-2017",
    "sample_size": 1219,
    "completed": true
  },
  "bonus_information": {
    "has_qualitative_components": false,
    "qualitative_methods": [],
    "qualitative_evidence_citation": null,
    "has_cost_data": true,
    "cost_mentions": "benefit-cost ratio of 2.3, internal rate of return of 26%",
    "cost_evidence_citation": "With a benefit-cost ratio of 2.3, the internal rate of return of the program is 26%, above the internal rate of return reported for India (24%) and Bangladesh (22%), and well above the social discount rate of 5%"
  },
  "evidence_citations": {
    "program_name_citation": "We test whether a 'big-push' intervention called the 'Targeting the Ultra Poor' (TUP) program can reduce poverty in one of the most difficult settings in the world, Afghanistan",
    "country_citation": "We assess the impact of the TUP program implemented in Balkh province in Afghanistan",
    "target_population_citation": "1,219 of the poorest households across 80 villages were randomly assigned through a public lottery to either a treatment or a control group"
  }
}
```
